A material metaphor is the unifying theory of a rationalized space and a system of motion. The material is grounded in tactile reality, inspired by the study of paper and ink, yet technologically advanced and open to imagination and magic.
The foundational elements of print-based design – typography, grids, space, scale, color, and use of imagery – guide visual treatments.
Motion respects and reinforces the user as the prime mover. Primary user actions are inflection points that initiate motion, transforming the whole design.
Within the material environment, virtual lights illuminate the scene. Key lights create directional shadows, while ambient light creates soft shadows from all angles.
Our android app offers live tracking of bus and estimated time of arrival of bus at a particular bus stop.
Unified app for both tracking and as a GPS receiver
In driver mode, We use the app for collecting the co-ordinates of moving bus and store it in the azure storage in a table and retrive those in the passenger mode and analyse it!
As of now track two buses in driver mode!

There are two buses that can be tracked, 5B and T70, a testing point has been added in 5B route.In driver mode one should login to the respective bus email ID and password, after that the received GPS data is updated in the azure table every 10seconds.
Passenger mode is for the end user.

In passenger mode, one needs to choose the desired bus and bus stop and also the refresh rate as every time the location of bus is updated a JSON file from google directions api will be downloaded, on pressing check the bus position is received from the azure table and bus stop positions are hard coded, google maps api is used to plot in the map and google directions api fetched the estimated time.
